page.title: 09Music in Pontarddulais
page.content: {Pontarddulais}is a small community with a very strong musical tradition. Today in 1985 it can boast five choirs; one male voice choir with 120 members, one mixed choir, two female choirs and a youth choir. The male voice choir is well known throughout Great Britain and has travelled extensively overseas and is always in great demand. It has on many occasions won at the National Eisteddfod of Wales, as has one of the ladies choirs, Cor Duffryn Dulais. They specialise in Welsh traditional songs and cerdd dant, a vocal form peculiar to Wales. The Aelwyd youth choir also has gained a number of successes in competitions. There is also a{Pontarddulais}brass band who currently compete in Section B of the National Brass Band Competition.
